overview: This module provides a comprehensive introduction to JavaScript arrays, a fundamental list datatype in programming. Designed for beginners new to JavaScript, it covers array creation, accessing and modifying elements, and basic array methods. The module concludes with an extended practical exercise where learners will create, modify, and iterate through an array of strings.
learnerPersona: Adult learners and aspiring professionals with little to no prior coding experience. Basic computer literacy is assumed.
prerequisites: Familiarity with fundamental programming concepts (variables, data types)

microlessons.title: Understanding JavaScript Arrays
microlessons.learningObjective: Define JavaScript arrays and explain how they organize data.
outline: Real-world analogies for arrays (e.g., shopping list, playlist)
Quick Check: Multiple choice question on array definition

microlessons.title: Array Components and Structure
microlessons.learningObjective: Identify the components of an array, including its elements and index positions.
outline: Practice: Identifying elements and their indexes in given arrays

microlessons.title: Creating Arrays in JavaScript
microlessons.learningObjective: Create arrays using JavaScript literal notation.
outline: Creating arrays with different data types
Empty arrays vs. arrays with initial values
Guided Practice: Creating various arrays in Visual Studio Code

microlessons.title: Accessing and Modifying Array Elements
microlessons.learningObjective: Access and modify elements within an array using square brackets.
outline: Adding new elements to specific positions
Hands-on Exercise: Accessing and modifying array elements

microlessons.title: Basic Array Methods
microlessons.learningObjective: Use basic array methods, such as push() and pop(), to manage array data.
outline: push(): adding elements to the end
pop(): removing elements from the end
Brief overview of other common methods (e.g., unshift(), shift())
Practice: Using push() and pop() to manipulate arrays
